body:
Are there any other mentions of `some/path/to/a/file` in the log?

I think something like this is happening

- the file is created from scratch
- it is closed before being uploaded
- it is re-opened before being uploaded
- the file is read from
- somehow the file is marked as not completely present on disk - this is the mystery
- the error appears

If you could post the VFS meta file if it happens that would be very useful.

You can find these in your rclone cache dir, under the remote path in the `vfsMeta` directory - each is a little JSON file. There will be one for the problem file. Ideally I'd like to see its contents, and also know how long the file should be.

I don't think I'll be able to debug this without a `-vv` log. I'd prefer an unredacted log, so if you want to share one with me privately to nick@craig-wood.com then that would be best.

> Are there any other mentions of `some/path/to/a/file` in the log?

Not before (file was just created) and not after (the file being unusable) except the ERROR log.

> If you could post the VFS meta file if it happens that would be very useful.

I restarted rclone to fix it so I guess the VFS meta "clean" now. Next time it occurs, I will stop rclone and copy the VFS meta somewhere else before starting it again.

> I don't think I'll be able to debug this without a `-vv` log. I'd prefer an unredacted log, so if you want to share one with me privately to [nick@craig-wood.com](mailto:nick@craig-wood.com) then that would be best.

I restarted my mount with `-vv`, w&s then. I will email you the results as soon as I got a new occurrence. Thank you!

I'm able to recreate this item pretty easily.

1) Stream a file in Plex
2) Rename the file while in cache (In my case I use Sonarr or Radarr to rename) and being played
3) Error appears

I just stumbled across this as I've done a lot of renaming all my media to fix / clean up some things so I just went through those steps now to recreate it.

On my end, this is a torrent client using rclone mount for the "complete" folder (incomplete torrents targets a local directory and when a file is finished, it is moved to the complete directory). So far I was not able to determinate the exact process triggering the bug.

So that does make sense, it would have to be uploading from the old location, get moved to the completed and if the star align, you'd trigger it that way.

I'd imagine you can:

1) cat file
2) move it (while streaming the cat)
3) see what happens in the log 

If there is an easy way to reproduce it, there is a better chance @ncw can identify/fix it and if your exact use case is in there (even if hard to produce), it would most likely be covered as the pattern "feels" the same.

> I'm able to recreate this item pretty easily.
> 
> 1. Stream a file in Plex
> 2. Rename the file while in cache (In my case I use Sonarr or Radarr to rename) and being played
> 3. Error appears
> 
> I just stumbled across this as I've done a lot of renaming all my media to fix / clean up some things so I just went through those steps now to recreate it.

I used that recipe to recreate the problem

Create a 1GB file in /tmp/mount

In one terminal

    rclone -vv mount --vfs-cache-mode full --bwlimit 1M /tmp/mount/ /mnt/tmp/

In another stream the file out

    pv </mnt/tmp/1GB >/dev/null

In a third, rename the file

    mv /mnt/tmp/1GB /mnt/tmp/1GB.moved

This produces this log in the mount

```
2022/02/18 16:02:27 INFO  : 1GB: Moved (server-side) to: 1GB.moved
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : 1GB(0xc00091e440): >_readAt: n=131072, err=<nil>
... reading continues fine until
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : vfs cache: looking for range={Pos:27000832 Size:131072} in [{Pos:0 Size:27258880}] - present true
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : 1GB.moved(0xc00091e440): >_readAt: n=131072, err=<nil>
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : &{1GB.moved (rw)}: >Read: read=131072, err=<nil>
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : &{1GB.moved (rw)}: Read: len=131072, offset=27131904
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : 1GB.moved(0xc00091e440): _readAt: size=131072, off=27131904
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : vfs cache: looking for range={Pos:27131904 Size:131072} in [{Pos:0 Size:27258880}] - present false
2022/02/18 16:02:28 ERROR : 1GB.moved: vfs cache: failed to _ensure cache internal error: downloaders is nil
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : 1GB.moved: vfs cache: failed to _ensure cache internal error: downloaders is nil is not out of space
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : 1GB.moved(0xc00091e440): >_readAt: n=0, err=internal error: downloaders is nil
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : &{1GB.moved (rw)}: >Read: read=0, err=internal error: downloaders is nil
....
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : vfs cache: looking for range={Pos:27254784 Size:4096} in [{Pos:0 Size:27258880}] - present true
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : 1GB.moved(0xc00091e440): >_readAt: n=4096, err=<nil>
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : &{1GB.moved (rw)}: >Read: read=4096, err=<nil>
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : &{1GB.moved (rw)}: Read: len=4096, offset=27258880
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : 1GB.moved(0xc00091e440): _readAt: size=4096, off=27258880
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : vfs cache: looking for range={Pos:27258880 Size:4096} in [{Pos:0 Size:27258880}] - present false
2022/02/18 16:02:28 ERROR : 1GB.moved: vfs cache: failed to _ensure cache internal error: downloaders is nil
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : 1GB.moved: vfs cache: failed to _ensure cache internal error: downloaders is nil is not out of space
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : 1GB.moved(0xc00091e440): >_readAt: n=0, err=internal error: downloaders is nil
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : &{1GB.moved (rw)}: >Read: read=0, err=internal error: downloaders is nil
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : &{1GB.moved (rw)}: Read: len=4096, offset=27258880
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : 1GB.moved(0xc00091e440): _readAt: size=4096, off=27258880
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : vfs cache: looking for range={Pos:27258880 Size:4096} in [{Pos:0 Size:27258880}] - present false
2022/02/18 16:02:28 ERROR : 1GB.moved: vfs cache: failed to _ensure cache internal error: downloaders is nil
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : 1GB.moved: vfs cache: failed to _ensure cache internal error: downloaders is nil is not out of space
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : 1GB.moved(0xc00091e440): >_readAt: n=0, err=internal error: downloaders is nil
2022/02/18 16:02:28 DEBUG : &{1GB.moved (rw)}: >Read: read=0, err=internal error: downloaders is nil
... The error is returned to `pv` here and its gets an EIO
... The rename finishes at this point also as it is now unblocked by the Read having finished
2022/02/18 16:02:43 INFO  : 1GB: vfs cache: renamed in cache to "1GB.moved"
2022/02/18 16:02:43 DEBUG : 1GB.moved: Updating file with 1GB.moved 0xc000920780
2022/02/18 16:02:43 DEBUG : : Added virtual directory entry vDel: "1GB"
2022/02/18 16:02:43 DEBUG : : Added virtual directory entry vAddFile: "1GB.moved"
2022/02/18 16:02:43 DEBUG : /: >Rename: err=<nil>
2022/02/18 16:02:43 DEBUG : /: Invalidating "1GB.moved"
```

That is quite complicated...

Looking at the code I can see it is renaming the file in the cache which causes the downloaders to be set to `nil` which is the ultimate cause of the problem.

I had a go at fixing this here - can you give it a go?

[v1.58.0-beta.6000.04177102c.fix-5984-vfs-rename-open](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-5984-vfs-rename-open/v1.58.0-beta.6000.04177102c.fix-5984-vfs-rename-open/) on branch [fix-5984-vfs-rename-open](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-5984-vfs-rename-open) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

This needs a unit test but let's see if I'm on the right track first!

I think that did what I expected.

I continued to read the file all the way through until my one iteration closed the file.

```
2022/02/18 12:54:21 DEBUG : test.mkv(0xc000364a80): >_readAt: n=131072, err=<nil>
2022/02/18 12:54:21 DEBUG : &{test.mkv (rw)}: >Read: read=131072, err=<nil>
2022/02/18 12:54:21 DEBUG : test.mkv(0xc000364a80): _readAt: size=131072, off=404094976
2022/02/18 12:54:21 DEBUG : vfs cache: looking for range={Pos:404094976 Size:131072} in [{Pos:0 Size:404291584}] - present true
2022/02/18 12:54:21 DEBUG : test.mkv(0xc000364a80): >_readAt: n=131072, err=<nil>
2022/02/18 12:54:21 DEBUG : &{test.mkv (rw)}: >Read: read=131072, err=<nil>
2022/02/18 12:54:21 DEBUG : &{test.mkv (rw)}: Read: len=65536, offset=404226048
2022/02/18 12:54:21 DEBUG : test.mkv(0xc000364a80): _readAt: size=65536, off=404226048
2022/02/18 12:54:21 DEBUG : vfs cache: looking for range={Pos:404226048 Size:65536} in [{Pos:0 Size:404291584}] - present true
2022/02/18 12:54:21 DEBUG : test.mkv(0xc000364a80): >_readAt: n=65536, err=<nil>
2022/02/18 12:54:21 DEBUG : &{test.mkv (rw)}: >Read: read=65536, err=<nil>
2022/02/18 12:54:21 DEBUG : &{test.mkv (rw)}: Read: len=4096, offset=404291584
2022/02/18 12:54:21 DEBUG : test.mkv(0xc000364a80): _readAt: size=4096, off=404291584
2022/02/18 12:54:21 DEBUG : test.mkv(0xc000364a80): >_readAt: n=0, err=EOF
2022/02/18 12:54:21 DEBUG : &{test.mkv (rw)}: >Read: read=0, err=<nil>
2022/02/18 12:54:23 DEBUG : : changeNotify: relativePath="jellyfish-400-mbps-4k-uhd-hevc-10bit.mkv", type=1
2022/02/18 12:54:23 DEBUG : : invalidating directory cache
2022/02/18 12:54:23 DEBUG : : >changeNotify:
2022/02/18 12:54:23 DEBUG : Dropbox root '': Checking for changes on remote
2022/02/18 12:54:23 DEBUG : : changeNotify: relativePath="test.mkv", type=1
2022/02/18 12:54:23 DEBUG : : >changeNotify:
2022/02/18 12:54:23 INFO  : jellyfish-400-mbps-4k-uhd-hevc-10bit.mkv: Moved (server-side) to: test.mkv
2022/02/18 12:54:23 INFO  : jellyfish-400-mbps-4k-uhd-hevc-10bit.mkv: vfs cache: renamed in cache to "test.mkv"
2022/02/18 12:54:23 DEBUG : test.mkv: Updating file with test.mkv 0xc000894900
2022/02/18 12:54:23 DEBUG : : Added virtual directory entry vDel: "jellyfish-400-mbps-4k-uhd-hevc-10bit.mkv"
2022/02/18 12:54:23 DEBUG : : Added virtual directory entry vAddFile: "test.mkv"
2022/02/18 12:54:23 DEBUG : /: >Rename: err=<nil>
2022/02/18 12:54:23 DEBUG : /: Invalidating "test.mkv"
2022/02/18 12:54:23 DEBUG : &{test.mkv (rw)}: Flush:
2022/02/18 12:54:23 DEBUG : test.mkv(0xc000364a80): RWFileHandle.Flush
2022/02/18 12:54:23 DEBUG : &{test.mkv (rw)}: >Flush: err=<nil>
2022/02/18 12:54:23 DEBUG : &{test.mkv (rw)}: Release:
2022/02/18 12:54:23 DEBUG : test.mkv(0xc000364a80): RWFileHandle.Release
2022/02/18 12:54:23 DEBUG : test.mkv(0xc000364a80): close:
2022/02/18 12:54:23 DEBUG : test.mkv: vfs cache: setting modification time to 2022-02-02 15:09:56 +0000 UTC
2022/02/18 12:54:23 DEBUG : test.mkv(0xc000364a80): >close: err=<nil>
2022/02/18 12:54:23 DEBUG : &{test.mkv (rw)}: >Release: err=<nil>
2022/02/18 12:54:23 DEBUG : /: Lookup: name="jellyfish-400-mbps-4k-uhd-hevc-10bit.mkv"
```

So I'd say that looks good to me.

Great - thank you for testing.

I'll try to write a unit test for the problem so it doesn't re-occur.
I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.58

issue.title: mount gdrive with vfs full cache - vfs cache: failed to _ensure cache internal error: downloaders is nil - reopens #5984

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

**STOP and READ**
**YOUR POST WILL BE REMOVED IF IT IS LOW QUALITY**:
Please show the effort you've put into solving the problem and please be specific.
People are volunteering their time to help! Low effort posts are not likely to get good answers!

If you think you might have found a bug, try to replicate it with the latest beta (or stable).
The update instructions are available at https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_selfupdate/

If you can still replicate it or just got a question then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

for a quick response instead of filing an issue on this repo.

If nothing else helps, then please fill in the info below which helps us help you.

**DO NOT REDACT** any information except passwords/keys/personal info.

You should use 3 backticks to begin and end your paste to make it readable.

Make sure to include a log obtained with '-vv'.

You can also use '-vv --log-file bug.log' and a service such as https://pastebin.com or https://gist.github.com/

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`



#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

Hi and thanks for your attention :)

I am reopening https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/5984 with this one as I have been experiencing it.

I have a Raspberry Pi 4 and I was testing out the download of a large torrent, when I saw that it frequently errors out. It appears that the error is not fatal in the sense that if you delete and re-add the torrent, then re-check the contents, it will continue from where it left off.
Edit: you need to delete the corrupted file, though (which you can see from the logs)

The structure of this particular torrent was 75GB with individual files of about 8GB each.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
```
rclone v1.53.3-DEV
- os/arch: linux/arm64
- go version: go1.15.9
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
Raspbian OS (Raspberry Pi 4), 64bit ARMv8, headless


#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
Google Drive


#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```
rclone mount \
        --allow-other \
        --buffer-size 256M \
        --dir-cache-time 72h \
        --drive-chunk-size 32M \
        --fast-list \
        --log-file /home/pi/rclone_debug.log \
        --cache-dir /media/mybook/tmp/rclone \
        --cache-tmp-upload-path /media/mybook/tmp/rclone \
        --vfs-read-chunk-size 128M \
        --vfs-read-chunk-size-limit off \
        --vfs-cache-mode full \
        --buffer-size 32M \
        --vfs-read-ahead 10G \
        --vfs-cache-max-size 1.5T \
        --vfs-cache-max-age 1000000h \
        --vfs-cache-poll-interval 5m \
        Filesystem: /home/pi/gdrive/Filesystem &
```

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
This is not possible, but I have the normal logs and will upload them here:

[rclone_debug.log](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/files/10048175/rclone_debug.log)


I guess the errors regarding the "source file is being updated" are not relevant and in fact they may be downgraded to `WARNING`.

<!--- Please keep the note below for others who read your bug report. -->

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the  [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.
